struct logger * l

Detailed Description

The logger module to be used globally within an application. The file of the main function of an application should define USE_GLOBAL_LOGGER, initializes it with init_logger() and register destroy_logger() with atexit() so that destroy_logger() will be called last by atexit().

Define Documentation

#define APP_ERR ( error_num,
msg,
...   ) 

Value:

app_err (__FILE__, __LINE__, error_num, \
                                              msg , ## __VA_ARGS__)
Convenient wrapper for calling logger::app_err.

#define ERR ( msg,
...   )     err (__FILE__, __LINE__, msg , ## __VA_ARGS__)

Convenient wrapper for calling logger::err.

#define GLOBAL_LOGGER   struct logger logger = {0}; struct logger *l = &logger

Convenient way to define a global logger object.

#define INFO ( msg,
...   )     info (__FILE__, __LINE__, msg , ## __VA_ARGS__)

Convenient wrapper for calling logger::info.

#define SETUP_LOGGER ( log_output,
err2str   ) 

Value:

do {                            \
    if (!atexit (destroy_logger) && !init_logger (log_output, err2str)) \
      break;                                                            \
    fprintf (stderr, "Cannot setup logger\n");                          \
    exit (EXIT_FAILURE);                                                \
  } while (0)
Convenient way to setup an application to use and destroy the global logger. This should be put as the first executable line in main() and must only be called once. If the logger needs to be modified, use destroy_logger() and then init_logger() instead of this macro.

#define SYS_ERR ( msg,
...   )     sys_err (__FILE__, __LINE__, msg , ## __VA_ARGS__)

Convenient wrapper for calling logger::sys_err.

Function Documentation

void destroy_logger ( void   ) 

Destroys the global logger by freeing up its resources. It is convenient to register this with atexit().

int init_logger ( const char *  log_output,
const char *(*)(int)  err2str 
)

Initializes the global logger.

Parameters:
[in] log_output the file where the message should be logged.
[in] err2str the function used to translate application error code to its meaning. If this is NULL, the application-specific error code will be logged as it is.
Returns:
zero if the installation is successful or non-zero if it is not.

Variable Documentation

struct logger* l

The global pointer to the global logger of an application.
